content:
Does anyone know what happened here? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76649#issuecomment-715275257

That PR ended up in a rollup (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78294, cc @Jonas Schievink) while in was in an unapproved state. I r+'d it before, but directly r-'d it again afterwards. (And r+ and r-'d it again because apparently bors reacts to edits too. ^^' But it ended with r-.) A few hours later it ends up in a few rollups.

Not much of a problem, as r- was just to squash the commits to avoid merging a merge commit. But I'm curious what went wrong. Was r- not enough? Or was this part of the desync problems earlier today?
bors sometimes loses track of this when it resyncs
It didn't complain that it was already approved when i r+'d it just now though. I guess it got sync'd again in the meantime and this all was just unfortunate timing.
(audited the list, all of them are actually approved)
